p: The COVID-19 pandemic triggered broad intolerance of uncertainty around policy responses and when life would return to “normal” as well as other emotions such as fear, stress, depression, and anxiety (Coelho et al., 2020; Pakpour and Griffiths, 2020). Media exposure, health anxiety, and risk for loved ones were predictors of fear of the coronavirus (Chu et al., 2022; Mertens et al., 2020). Traumatic stress symptoms and fear of economic factors were also associated with the coronavirus (Jacmin-Park et al., 2020).
